Key Match Events: Trent Alexander-Arnold scored an exquisite free-kick from the left side of the box to make it 2-0 for England
Declan Rice scored the third goal for England from a cross by Ollie Watkins
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley emphasized the importance of control in the game
The recall for Angel Gomes alongside Declan Rice in midfield was intended to pick the lock against Finland's compact 5-4-1 system
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley expressed relief and satisfaction with the win, stating that it was a return to the tranquil progress of his first camp in September
Carsley distanced himself from the England job, stating that he will go back to his old job with the under-21s at the end of his interim tenure in November
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jack Grealish opened the scoring with a cool finish after a lovely flick from Angel Gomes
Harry Kane played as the No 9, and the team's style was more conventional compared to the all-out attack against Greece
Others: The Finland goalkeeper Lukas Hradecky was a titan at Wembley, but Grealish simply opened up his body for the sidefoot finish and the sucking-thumb celebration for his recently born baby girl
